unnormalised: Okay, so you're thinking of buying a flat in Gurgaon and want to find the best builder, right? That's a big decision, like picking the right role for Shah Rukh Khan in a Yash Chopra film!
normalised: Okay, so you are thinking of buying a flat in Gurgaon and want to find the best builder, right? That is a big decision, like picking the right role for Shah Rukh Khan in a Yash Chopra film!

unnormalised: Builder reviews are ESSENTIAL. Seriously, don't skip this step. We almost got burned by a developer who promised the moon but delivered, well, dust.
normalised: Builder reviews are essential. Seriously, don't skip this step. We almost got burned by a developer who promised the moon but delivered, well, dust.

unnormalised: Where do you find good reviews? Look beyond the shiny brochures and website testimonials. Check out online forums like IndianRealEstateForum and PropertyPistol. Also, talk to people living in their existing projects. Visit the projects themselves. Ask about common area maintenance (Rs. 3 per sq ft is standard in many places), waterlogging issues during the monsoon, and how responsive the builder is to complaints *after* possession.
normalised: Where do you find good reviews? Look beyond the shiny brochures and website testimonials. Check out online forums like Indian Real Estate Forum and Property Pistol. Also, talk to people living in their existing projects. Visit the projects themselves. Ask about common area maintenance (rupees three per square foot is standard in many places), waterlogging issues during the monsoon, and how responsive the builder is to complaints after possession.

unnormalised: My cousin, Priya, nearly bought an apartment from a builder with a "reputation" – turns out that reputation was for delayed possessions of 2+ years! She dodged a bullet thanks to someone in her IIT Delhi alumni group sharing their experience.
normalised: My cousin, Priya, nearly bought an apartment from a builder with a "reputation" – turns out that reputation was for delayed possessions of two plus years! She dodged a bullet thanks to someone in her I I T Delhi alumni group sharing their experience.

unnormalised: Also, try looking at consumer court judgements online. If there are multiple cases against a builder, that's a huge red flag. And if you are investing in a property on EMI, make sure the builder is not in any kind of payment irregularity with their lenders.
normalised: Also, try looking at consumer court judgements online. If there are multiple cases against a builder, that is a huge red flag. And if you are investing in a property on E M I, make sure the builder is not in any kind of payment irregularity with their lenders.

unnormalised: Finally, don't rely solely on online reviews. Engage a good lawyer for due diligence. A few thousand rupees spent on a lawyer can save you lakhs in the long run. Good luck with your property hunt!
